1. Launching public awareness campaigns: The government can use mass media to create awareness on environmental issues and provide guidelines on sustainable living. They can run campaigns on TV, radio, and social media, emphasizing the significance of eco-friendly lifestyle.

2. Implementing eco-friendly policies: The government can adopt eco-friendly policies to encourage businesses to reduce their carbon emissions. These actions can include providing incentives for the production and use of low-emission products, charging higher taxes for high-emission products, and providing subsidies for green technologies.

3. Educating school children and youth: Educating the next generation is crucial in environmental conservation. The government can develop programs for children to learn about climate change and sustainability in school, make it a part of the curriculum, and encourage extra-curricular activities that promote eco-friendliness.

4. Providing grants for clean technologies: The government can provide grants, subsidies, and financial incentives to build clean energy infrastructure, research innovative, green technologies, and support renewable energy projects.

5. Encouraging public participation: Advocating for public participation in eco-friendly initiatives, encouraging people to participate in environmental conservation programs such as recycling drives, tree planting initiatives, and workshops, etc. 

These are some of the steps the government can implement to educate the public on reducing carbon footprints and environmental responsibility.
